list.name: Default
list.comment: Add functionality to add new categories to the database. Existing categories are displayed as soon as the user opens the tab.

task.summary: Default task
Update the workspace file
Update the Zurb template readme to more accurately reflect the actual project this is.
Watch for changes in files that have PHP and end with .php. Once changes occur then reload the browsers.
Update the readme to more accurately reflect the real project and not the starter project.
Add connection functionality to us PDO.
Change the navigation from roles to pages. Tab interface already satifies the requirement for users roles, now navigation is more appropriate on the page with traditional links.
Use a password library from GitHub.
Clear sessions and move the user to the login screen.
Add logic to the login screen.
Build the registration form for new users to add their own basic information.
Quit spellchecking everything!
Move the logic behind the registration to a different file.
Updates to today's files. 2016-05-18
Add new static pages and call them from the main-nav
Update the site name from the defualt to Asset Management
Begin the change for the search button to be a form.
Add new partials to be called by other files.
Move the logic from the login.php to its own file to be called from the form. Simplify things a little bit.
Remove the form logic from this page
Update file paths to call and reference other php files from.
Update the project files to include syncable data. Add the database dialect so SQL syntax errors shushh.

Change the HTML to PHP in order to use PHP and sessions on the first page.
Panini is looking for HTML files, especially a default.html and this symlinks satisfies Panini while allowing the developer to use his/her tools like syntax highlighting in a php file.
Compress the watch tasks to watch for php *and* html files in the same directory.
Change the HTML to PHP in order to use PHP and sessions on the first page.
Now I can test that the logged in user is actually logged in with session variables.
Check to see if the user is logged into the site. If the user is not logged in then redirect him/her to the login page.
Perform some clean up on the page. Remove satisfied TODO from list.

Add functionality for different user roles and the access that the user gets depending on that role.
Remove the tabs interface from the index page and place it in a newly created profile page. Update the select statement in login-action.php to retrieve the role_id from the database. Also, add that role_id to a variable and use that in conditionals later. Use a nested if/statement to display tabs and tab navigation depending on the level of access each user is allowed.
Update from the previous to explicitly watch for each ending file type instead of clumping them together.
Fixed a bug where an input type was incorrectly entered into the markup.
Create and add forms for specific tabs. Use a logical naming structure to indicate what this file is for.
Display the tabs and panels in a correct, logical order. Replace instances of 'company' with the more correct 'manufacturer'
Clean up that tabs panel. Removed the markup in favor of placing it all in the partial to be called at the appropriate time.

Display assigned assets.
Upon the user logging in the applicaiton the profile screen will immedietly display what assets have already been assigned and to whom. There is no interaction on this screen as it is read-only. The partial is called and the partial calls the action script.
Add the html parital. There is only one way that Panini calls for the partials and it is if the file has an extension of .html and *not* .php
Add functionality to add new categories to the database. Existing categories are displayed as soon as the user opens the tab.
Add functionality to add new categories to the database. Existing categories are displayed as soon as the user opens the tab.
Add a couple words to the PHPStorm dictionary: compat and ircmaxell
Add functionality to add and display a manufacturer to the user. If the manufacturer isn't displayed the user can add it.
Renamed the file to keep with style.
Add functionality to add new assets to the database. Existing assets are displayed as soon as the user opens the tab.
Renamed the file from company to manufacturer
Updated the template call for the newly renamed file.

Add functionality for the user to create a new asset to the system.
Existing assets are already posted on the page but if the user does not see an asset that they need they can add it now.
Remove PHP tags from the template file.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value: Remove PHP tags from the template file.
